panels.visual: Eskil holds his hands out palms up - the gesture of surrender, of someone showing they mean no harm. His voice is calm, almost gentle through the helm. Hind watches, assessing.
panels.dialogue: Eskil: "There are many tribes. Excuse bad memories."

panels.visual: Giovanni introduces himself, making the sign of the cross. His travel-stained robes mark him clearly as a Christian priest, a curiosity in these lands.
panels.dialogue: Giovanni: "I am a priest of the Christian god - the god of Arabs and Jews also."

panels.visual: Gan speaks of seeking a new family, her falcon perched on her arm. Her dog presses close to her heel. Her eyes hold old pain - a survivor of destruction seeking belonging.
panels.dialogue: Gan: "I seek a new family. Mine was hunted and destroyed."

panels.visual: Lueduo emerges from the shadows where he has been watching. His serpent-touched eyes catch the lamplight. He speaks little but his presence speaks volumes.
panels.narration: Lueduo had emerged from the desert with secrets written in his silence.
